spaceName: 4016MFH - AEB for BA International Fashion Management and Marketing 1 - 2122SEPDEC

value: What would I do differently in future?

possible_responses: What would I do differently in future?
data.stimulus:
Structuring Reflective Writing

Drag the questions into the appropriate sections.

value: What would I do differently in future?

When we began our project, tasks were shared out equally amongst members of my team. However, the tasks were not seen as equally difficult by all team members. As a result, the sense of unfairness made it challenging for us to work together as a team.

Social interdependence theory recognises a type of group interaction called “positive interdependence” (Johnson & Johnson, 2008), which we did not experience in my group. This put my group at a disadvantage, as many studies show that cooperative learning experiences encourage higher achievement.” (Maughan & Webb, 2010)

In the end, we managed to complete our project through further negotiation, but to improve the process, we perhaps needed a team leader to help encourage discussion and cooperation when tasks are being shared out. In future group work I would probably suggest this at the beginning of the project.

data.stimulus:
Structuring Reflective Writing: an example

Organise the reflective writing according to the structure.

value: When we began our project, tasks were shared out equally amongst members of my team. However, the tasks were not seen as equally difficult by all team members. As a result, the sense of unfairness made it challenging for us to work together as a team.

Social interdependence theory recognises a type of group interaction called “positive interdependence” (Johnson & Johnson, 2008), which we did not experience in my group. This put my group at a disadvantage, as many studies show that cooperative learning experiences encourage higher achievement.” (Maughan & Webb, 2010)

In the end, we managed to complete our project through further negotiation, but to improve the process, we perhaps needed a team leader to help encourage discussion and cooperation when tasks are being shared out. In future group work I would probably suggest this at the beginning of the project.

stems: Has the author described what happened and how they felt?
Has the author analysed the situation and considered why things happened?
Has the author used theory to help them understand their experience?
Has the author used personal language (e.g. I, my) to help them reflect on their experience?
Has the author written in a suitably formal academic style?
Has the author checked their writing for errors (e.g. spelling, punctuation, grammar)?
data.stimulus: Read the reflective writing again and answer the questions in the checklist below.
